text: hello and welcome to cupcake addictions
milkshake cake pop tutorial I'm going to
be showing you how to make this gorgeous
little bit of an old style milkshake
cake pop I love these because you don't
need to have any fancy cake pop stands
they do stand on their own and I just
think they're really really cute take on
the cake pops tools and equipment that
we will be using today I've got a knife
a ziplock bag I've got a pair of
scissors I've got a straw and I'm using
that as my little milkshake straw today
so I use these as cake pop sticks from
time-to-time and I pick they're a paper
straw but they're quite a high quality
paper straw so they do hold the weight
of a cake pop and that perfect for this
but they just give you a guest something
to pick up your little milkshake with so
that they can eat it I've got my

decorate now if you don't have a great

to this stage ready to dip I have a

addiction and I will leave a link to
that in the description box below now
I've also got my one that I've
appreciates that has been pre
refrigerated so I'll be showing you how
to achieve this shape and then we'll be
refrigerating it for about 15 minutes
this one's already been done just to
save us a little bit of time I've put a
piece of wax paper or grease proof paper
I've got two unmelted pink candy melts
you'll need one per milkshake I've got a
couple of red M&Ms once again one per

sprinkles or nonpareils some melted pink

just white chocolate or white candy
melts so let's get started now the first
thing that we want to do is we're going
to shape our ball so to shape your cake
pop ball you've got your nice round ball
and you're just going to rock it in the
palm of your hand kind of make almost
like an elongated strawberry shape now
you do want to taper it down because you
want it to be relatively sort of skinny
at the bottom and then I'm just going to
use my finger just to give it a slightly
flat bottom so you wanted as skinny as
you can at the bottom but you don't to
go too crazy on it because it still has
to be able to support its own weight now
I took the back of my knife and this is
more just as a bit of a guide for me for
when I'm dipping I use the back of my
knife to just make a bit of a guideline
around and that's going to define the
bottom of my milkshake and the top so
you should have something that looks
sort of like that
and can pop that into the fridge for
about 15 minutes until it's really nice
and firm so as I mentioned I've got mine
here and that's been pre done and that's
ready to go so it's really firm if I
squeeze it it's not going to squeeze out
of shape so what we're going to do is
we're going to take the cake pop ball
and our straw now normally I would dip
the cake pop stick with a lollipop stick
into the chocolate and then put it into
the cake pop but for this one I'm going
to hold the cake pop ball with the
bottom half and I'm just going to dip
the top half down to that line perfect
now I'm going to take our straw dip it

but it's not going to matter do not

because it's all going to be covered in

helps them to go in a little bit easier
on a nice angle there so you can see
there that's going to make our straw
leave that straw long for now because it
gives you something that you can dip
with and it's a I guess it's a good
little kind of a grip stick or something
that you can pick your cake pop up with
now from here and you don't need to wait
for that to dry you want to just dip in
the bottom half when you're double
dipping like this or when you're half
half dipping you do need to make sure
that the two chocolates meet up if
you've got any of that cake pop balls
showing through your chocolate it's
actually going to sort of weep a little

just dipping that in now don't worry
once again if it's not a beautiful
beautiful even coat do make sure that

give it a little shake off and then you
want to take one of your candy melts and
just thinning them on that wax paper
this is going to give us our flat bottom
now you want to hold that until it's

a couple of minutes alright so we're
back and I'm pretty happy that that's
fairly well set so what we're going to
do now is we're going to rediff that

melts so a whole lot including that

base there give it a little bit of a

little bit that's going to make that
really nice to find foot and you just
want to hold that now until that sets
all right so now that that's completely
set you can pull it off the wax paper
and you can see that you've got your
really lovely little foot now it's still
not quite looking like our milkshake
because that top is not the right size
in proportion to the bottom so what
we're going to do is you can take your
stick now and you can snip it off so you
just want to look like kind of a bit of
a straw size and I like to do this now
because otherwise you could wait for the

so once you've done that just fashion
that round edge on the straw again and
you should have something looking a

all right beautiful
so now you want to take your white
chocolate and this is where we're going
to make I guess the the foamy frothy top
of our milkshake so just tip in just a
little bit of that white chocolate you
don't need too much of it let any air
out just so that you don't make a an air

going to cut off quite a fine tip no
exact size yeah and don't be too fussy
with it what you're going to do is
you're just going to pick it up by the
little straw and I'm just going to kind
of just swirl around so you're making
kind of just a bit of a textured raised
milk shaky top do make sure that you
come down over the sides of that pink so
you want to cover up the joint
where the pink joins the white and you
want to make sure that it's really nice
and it gets frothy over the top now if
you want you can give it just a couple
of tiny little taps on the bench not too
hard and that will just help some of
those little drizzles there drizzle down
the side of the cup and then we're going
to take this is the messy part take your
sprinkles on your nonpareils and just
sprinkle them on top like little bubbles
all right it looks like it's been
snowing in my kitchen now to finish that
off completely you want to take just one
of your M&Ms and I like to stick them
sort of on their side just to make them
look like nice big round cherries to
slide that into the white chocolate so
there you've got make sure that it's
nice and centered so there you've got
your really cool kind of 50s style
milkshake bar milkshake cake pop I hope
